author: Felix Day
title: Snowstorm causes traffic chaos and power outage in Glenville
text:
by Felix Day
Thu, January 2nd 2025 at 5:34 PM Updated Fri, January 3rd 2025 at 8:25 PM Snowstorm causes traffic chaos and power outage in Glenville (WRGB) TOPICS:
Snowstorm Traffic Chaos Crashes Glenville Power outage Utility pole Route 5 Glenville, NY — A sudden snowstorm this afternoon creates havoc in Glenville, causing a series of traffic incidents and a power outage affecting nearly 80 people.
A tractor-trailer veered off the road, and another was entangled with telephone wires along Route 5 near Maalwyck Park.
According to 511 NY traffic maps, the slick roads, compounded by the snow, led to a downed utility pole, prompting the closure of all lanes to traffic.
Glenville police say, they responded to 18 crashes due to the snow.
Authorities say, while none of the incidents were serious, the volume of accidents stretched police resources thin.
Power has since been restored and we will keep you updated as information comes to us.
